text: Tyson Colby Brummett (August 15, 1984July 3, 2020) was an American baseball player. He was born in Columbus, Mississippi. In 2012, he played as a pitcher in one Major League Baseball (MLB) game for the Philadelphia Phillies. He batted and threw right-handed and was mainly a starting pitcher. Brummett was drafted by the Phillies in 2007. He played for five of their minor league affiliates until 2012, when the organization promoted him to the major leagues. He later signed for the Toronto Blue Jays and Los Angeles Dodgers. On July 3, 2020, Brummett was piloting an airplane that crashed in the mountains north of Alpine, Utah. He died along with three passengers. He was 35. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1984 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Accidental deaths in the United States Category:Aviation deaths in the United States Category:American baseball players Category:Los Angeles Dodgers players Category:Philadelphia Phillies players Category:Toronto Blue Jays players
title: Tyson Brummett
